column4: update manager is frozen.. what is the name of that process so that i can kill it?
lookup pid in htop
pidof htop returns nothing
or sudo killall update-manager; htop would list your running processes
is htop a GUI of top or something?
thanks
if you killed it, run : sudo dpkg --configure -a
okay, and what does that do?
checks for dpkg state, as you interupted in unkwon state for now
i see, you have any idea why it froze? looks like a kernel update and things to do with the new kernel
no, you could check the logs though, mostly something wrong with network
that makes sense actually im not sure why but my net keeps flaking out.. took me like 15 minutes to download xchat but it fluctuates.. i think its my router
maybe slow repo ? can use synaptic to find the fastest one for you
how do i go about that.. once i have synaptic open
settings > repos > download from > other > find...
i see it thanks :]
synaptics still open in parallel ?
i guess, what does that mean? nope software center isnt open
what is the name of the process for software center?
same as half an hour ago, plus removing apt-lock (I guess your synaptic was still open from repo-change)
: no, see ActionP, problem was more than one apt/dpkg process at one time
np
